page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: In the centre of Millbrook is the Tan Yard,now a public garden.It was opened at Whitsun 1985,by Mrs.Bond and the Mayor of Plouider (Brittany).In the past leather was tanned there, previously it was stables. On the Quay is the old Smithy,now a garage.It was the centre of the village,and has been reclaimed as a carpark.The old Mill Pond has been used as a district rubbish dump,and has been reclaimed for Playing Fields, Football Field and Social Club.The old Mill is used for maintenance of River Trip boats .The old brickworks have been demolished and the clay pits are now derelict.The Meadow behind West Street is now a Car Park.An 1873 survey lists:2 tailors, 3 bakers,watchmaker,grocer, tanner,3 carpenters,3 blacksmiths,ironmonger, wheelwright, haberdasher,3 butchers, greengrocer,3 boot and shoe makers.
